column1: From the episode (and that reddit post)

column3: Negotiation. Discussion.

column5: They haggled back and forth for some time on a price.
column6: The two groups worked for some time to find a mutually acceptable deal that both sides would benefit from.
column7: The ambasador worked hard to broker a deal between everyone involved.
column8: The talks for creating a climate agreement were ongoing today.
column9: They talked for hours to try and resolve the disagreement.
column10: Coming to a compromise was likely the best course of action.

column3: Cessation. Stoppage, an extension of freezing.

column5: The work was halted until they would decide to continue.
column6: They decided to abruptly stop.
column7: The manufacturing line was interrupted.
column8: She forbid him to continue on this path.
column9: The computer had halted it's execution.
column10: They decided to stop travelling on this path.
column11: He decided to no longer continue his job.
column12: The flow of water was iterrupted, and now remained still.
column13: They announced an immediate cessation to any hostilities.

column3: Failure, even Death.

column7: The pipe burst, causing a flood.

column1: Darmok. Darmok at Tanagra. Darmok and Jilad at Tanagra.
column3: Cooperation. A joint venture with a mutually beneficial goal.
column4: The two sides put aside their differences and worked together towards a common goal.
column5: When they tried together, they were able to lift the heavy rock.
column6: She helped him with the project.
column7: Knowing they would both be needed, they went together.
column8: He held the board, while she hammered it in.
column9: They moved the bricks together so the job would go faster.
column10: The governments had a cooperative agreement and mutually beneficial relationship.
column11: They shared the work, with her cooking and him doing the dishes.
column12: Their easy working relationship made their task work out better than expected.
column13: When he worked with her, they were able to do twice the work of either of them individually.

column3: Departure, in a very broad sense. A going forward with the new plan, when Dathon introduced his new plan or a change from a course of action or location, used by the Tamarian First Officer when they leave.
column4: They decided to try a new approach.
column5: They left the city.
column6: He decided to move on to the next island.
column7: With their old plans in ruin, it was time to try their next idea.
column8: It was time to let go, so she disembarked.
column9: He walked out the door.
column10: After changing their methods, they started on a new trajectory.
column11: She went down the trail, off into the distance.
column12: She quit her job and started a different job.
column13: With their preparation complete, they began their road trip.

column3: Offering. Freely giving something. Aid. Assistance.
column4: She asked if he wanted an apple.
column5: They offered him a bandage.
column6: He asked if she wanted some of her sandwich.
column7: They made the book available for anyone who wanted it.
column8: The gardener offered seeds to anyone who wanted them.
column9: She pointed to the kettle and asked if anyone wanted some tea.
column10: He looked cold, so she offered him a blanket.
column11: They told their neighbours to feel free to take some firewood.
column12: The company was giving out free samples to anyone who asked.
column13: The child offered his toy to his friend.

column3: Retention. Denying the return of something.
column4: He refused her gift of the apple.
column5: He decided not to take the bandaid.
column6: She said no to his offer of food.
column7: He told his friend that he didn't want the book right now.
column9: She said she was not interested in the offer of tea.
column10: He didn't want to take the blanket.
column11: The neighbours refused the offer of firewood.
column12: She declined the offer of one of the samples.
column13: They said they didn't want the toy, and to keep it.

column3: Ignorance. Not knowing or choosing to know.
column4: Though she told him what would happen, he didn't listen.
column5: They were ignorant of any scientific facts or observations.
column6: He hadn't tried to learn the knowledge he needed.
column7: She didn't know, but should have.
column8: He hadn't wanted to be taught.
column9: The child didn't want to go to listen to their lessons anymore.
column10: The business intentionally refused to examine a possibility.
column11: They didn't want to familiarize themselves with the situation.
column12: They preferred being uneducated on the topic.
column13: She chose to reject the evidence before examining it.

column3: Inutility. Nothing can be done to help, cannot emotionally support or treat an injury.
column4: No matter what he did, the outcome would be the same.
column5: There was nothing that could be done to help him.
column6: She tried to make him feel better, but it was useless.
column7: She knew nothing she could do would make it better.
column8: Regardless of their action, the wound still hurt.
column9: His injury was incurable.
column10: Nothing seemed to help the pain, regardless of how much he tried.
column11: No treatment was available for her illness.
column12: His arm hurt, and no treatment options were available.
column13: The emotional pain was deep, and he knew it wouldn't improve.

column3: Understanding.
column4: Though she didn't understand before, now she did.
column5: He recognized clearly what he couldn't see before.
column6: They suddenly realized what had elluded them.
column7: The child figured it out.
column8: Eventually they were able to get the idea behind it.
column9: After being told, she suddenly realized what she'd misunderstood.
column10: He'd learned a new skill.
column11: She was definitely getting the hang of it.
column12: The business was now able to explain what happened.
column13: They were now able to successfully interpret the results.

column3: Imbecility. Not understanding.
column4: He did not understand.
column5: She couldn't comprehend what they were trying to tell her.
column6: They didn't seem to be able to fathom it.
column7: No matter how hard they tried, he just couldn't seem to get the picture.
column8: He couldn't appreciate what they were trying to say.
column9: The child failed to grasp the advanced topic.
column10: She never realized what they were working to convey.
column11: They did not comprehend.

column13: They lacked the knowledge to discern what was being said.

column1: Chenza at court. The court of silence.

column5: The results were beyond reproach.

column8: The condition they found themselves in was unambiguous.

column11: He understood the situation was

column1: Uzani. His army at Lashmir. With fist open.

column3: Obstruction. Barring the way, to not do something.

column3: Seeing something surprising?

column4: She enjoyed it.

column3: I told you so / Before you were not seeing things clearly, but now you are.

column3: No progress is being made

column3: Begging or pleading for something.

column4: His duty as a physician was clear.
column5: The professional responsibilities of someone in her position were understood.

column4: She preferred to work alone, without assistance.
column6: Though her friends were there to help, she hadn't asked for it.

column3: I feel better.

column3: Following your heart into something dangerous, when your mind knows better. Feeling deep regret.
column4: She couldn't have understood when she did it, the pain she would feel because of it.

column3: A person living in a distant/far off place from where they are normally from.
column4: Though his home was in the North, he was currently travelling in the South.

column3: Not accepting council / not believing what you're told, and having to learn something through experiencing it (the hard way)
column4: She didn't accept his lesson, and eventually learned the hard way.

column3: Being in a difficult situation, with a lot of responsibility.
column4: It was the captain's duty to make these sorts of life and death decisions.
column5: Though he lost his job, he still had a family to provide for.
column6: In spite of being sick, she still had to go in to work or no one would be able to open the store.

column3: Either (i) relief, or (ii) scientists experimenting on lower life forms.
